document_data.name: Asgard
document_data.mainbody: The realm of '''Asgard''' was the largest

Description.Cosmography:
Usually, Asgard bordered the realms of [[Alfheim]], [[Jotunheim]], and [[Vanaheim]]. The Iving River served as the border between Asgard and Jotunheim.

The [[Bifrost]], an interplanar means of travel to the [[Prime Material plane]], was also located in Asgard, and the interplanar tree [[Yggdrasil]] had branches here.
Description.Climate: The gods of Asgard magically controlled its weather such that it mimicked the gloomy light of northern climates and had powerful winters. The other seasons were also extreme.

Notable Locations.Mount Joy: The tallest peak of Asgard, which had been flattened.
Notable Locations.[[Gladsheim (hall)|Gladsheim]]: Located on Mount Joy, this massive hall of [[Odin]]'s was the feasting hall of the entire Norse pantheon.
Notable Locations.Thrudheim: The domain of Thor and his wife Sif.
Notable Locations.Vingolf: The domain of Odin's wife Frigga.
Notable Locations.Plain of Ida: A field between Bifrost and the hall of Gladsheim.
Notable Locations.Plain of Vigrid: A field between Bifrost and the walls of Asgard.
Notable Locations.Iving River: Asgard's largest river, it was magically warm, such that it was impossible for it to ever freeze.
Notable Locations.Lake Amsvartnir: A lake just outside of Asgard.
Notable Locations.Landvidi: The domain of Vidar, a land of tall grasses and young trees.
Notable Locations.[[Valhalla]]: The home of the einheriar and the valkyries and the third of Odin's three halls.
Notable Locations.Himinborg: A town located on the border of the realm,
